reason.raw: We're turning down this PR in order to sort out some version control issues. It turns out the differences between Mercurial and Git are not superficial.
reason.html: We're turning down this PR in order to sort out some version control issues. It turns out the differences between Mercurial and Git are not superficial.

description.raw:
This PR addresses issue #2.

Currently, this enforces a tilde `~` between the version numbers and the prerelease suffix (which is allowed to be any string).

From cmake's point of view, the prerelease suffix is entirely superficial. This will not really support the ability to have both a prerelease and final release of the same version installed at the same time. (Well, you can have them both installed at the same time, but you cannot use `find_package` in  `cmake` to select the prerelease version instead of the final release version.)
description.html:
This PR addresses issue #2.

Currently, this enforces a tilde ~ between the version numbers and the prerelease suffix (which is allowed to be any string).

From cmake's point of view, the prerelease suffix is entirely superficial. This will not really support the ability to have both a prerelease and final release of the same version installed at the same time. (Well, you can have them both installed at the same time, but you cannot use find_package in cmake to select the prerelease version instead of the final release version.)

title.raw: Adding support for specifying that a version is a prerelease
title.html: Adding support for specifying that a version is a prerelease

This PR addresses issue #2.

Currently, this enforces a tilde `~` between the version numbers and the prerelease suffix (which is allowed to be any string).

From cmake's point of view, the prerelease suffix is entirely superficial. This will not really support the ability to have both a prerelease and final release of the same version installed at the same time. summary.html:
This PR addresses issue #2.

Currently, this enforces a tilde ~ between the version numbers and the prerelease suffix (which is allowed to be any string).

From cmake's point of view, the prerelease suffix is entirely superficial. This will not really support the ability to have both a prerelease and final release of the same version installed at the same time. (Well, you can have them both installed at the same time, but you cannot use find_package in cmake to select the prerelease version instead of the final release version.)

reason: We're turning down this PR in order to sort out some version control issues. It turns out the differences between Mercurial and Git are not superficial.
